intro: Galium aristatum subsp. schultesii, commonly known as Schultes' bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Schultes' bedstraw thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
